Module simplifier
Package ie.gmit.dip

Class TerminalInputParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.TerminalInputParser
  • public class TerminalInputParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Concrete class whose primary responsibility is to perform various terminal/console parsing operations. Contains methods which allow for retrieving single and multi-line String input, retrieving Integer input, a method for choosing a String item from an ArrayList, a method to pause the terminal until the user gives a prompt to continue, and a method to close the composed scanner object. Relies on a class level Scanner instance for terminal parsing.
    Since:
    JavaSE-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kieran P. Somers

    • Method Detail

      • getSingleLineTextInput

        public java.lang.String getSingleLineTextInput()
        Method which allows the use to provide multiple line (return character separated) fields at the command line, which are compiled into a single String. The method has O(c) running time.
        Returns:
        String the String parsed from the terminal input.

      • getMultiLineInput

        public java.lang.String getMultiLineInput()
        Method which allows the use to provide multiple line (return character separated) fields at the command line, which are compiled into a single String. Ignoring the TerminalTitleWriter.writeLine() calls, this method has O(n) running time where n is the number of lines entered at the command line.
        Returns:
        String the String built from the multiline terminal input.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIntegerInput

        public java.lang.Integer getIntegerInput()
        Method for parsing a single integer from the command line. Has O(c) running time.
        Returns:
        Integer the int read from the terminal input.

      • chooseStringFromList

        public java.lang.String chooseStringFromList​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> strings)
        This method allows the user to choose an option from an ArrayList of String types. This method has O(n) running time where n is the number of elements in the ArrayList provided as input.
        Parameters:
        strings - an ArrayList containing a collection of String types to print to the screen.
        Returns:
        String the String which the user has selected.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        A simple method which pauses the screen until the user hits return. This method has O(c) running time.

      • closeScanner

        public void closeScanner()
        Method for closing the composed scanner. This method has O(c) running time.
